reviewText: INTROThere's a lot of mixed reviews but still a lot of unanswered questions. I am going to try to review the game and explain at least well enough to help you decide if you should buy this or not. Keep in mind this is MY opinion on the game, it might not necessarily be the same as everyone else!\n\nDifferences between Free" Version and Steam VersionI'll start by informing you that the pack Steam is selling
date: is also available on the Disney Infinity website. You can also download the game for free on the same website.\nAlthough the game is supposedly Free to Play
recommended: the basic version of the game doesn't offer you that much
hoursPlayed: presenting itself more as a demo. You have access to 3 of the many characters that rotate each 5 days
voteText: you can play demos of the Play Sets (these are like open world story modes) and you have limited access to toy box (it's kinda like a creative mode). I recommend you download and play the game for free through the Disney Infinity website before you buy any pack.\n\nBy buying one of the starter packs (in this case
helpfulPercent: the Marvel Super Heroes one) you unlock:\n- The Avengers play set (basically it's an open world story mode)\n- 3 permanent characters (Thor
votesTotal: Iron Man)\n- Full access to toy box 2.0 (creative mode where you can create your own maps/levels
column19:
this is where the game really shines)

PROS:
+ Huge possibilities - Through the Toy Box mode

reviewText: Quick overview for those wondering what exactly this version of Disney Infinity 2.0 is:\n1. This is the full version of the game, no toybox only" version or the likes we saw before.\n2. What you get with this starter set is three figures (Thor
date: Black Widow and Iron-man) and the Avengers play-set (essentially an open-world 5-hours long story mode) plus a collection of free-to-try characters that rotate at certain dates. You also get two toy box minigames:\none is a tower-defense styled game and the other is a roguelike styled game (and also includes randomly generated floors).\n3. There are no direct uses for physical figures. To compensate
recommended: digital figures are cheaper and physical figures come with download-codes for unlocking them.\n4. There is pretty much zero graphics customization available beyond different resolutions

reviewText:
• If you understand the value of money, then this game is not for you.
• If you think this product is about the Marvel Super Hero story gameplay, then this game is not for you.
• If you think this is an open sandbox with every tool already at your disposal to build whatever you want, then this game is not for you.

So, then... What is Disney Infinity? This product is a pseudo game builder that is intended for older children or young adults.
Yes, there is a pre-built Avengers (or Spider-man, or Guardians) game, but it's really just there as a means to an end... you are playing or paying to unlock new ways to theme the game you will build, or to fast-track access to a wide variety of models and features to add to what you build.

THE CONS:
The price is hard to justify, but once you turn that portion of your brain off (which I did when TF2 introduced micro transactions) you learn to let it slide.
The custom Exteriors & INteriors you build have a strong tendency to become corrupt... items disappearing (including floors!), INterior rooms becoming misaligned and closed off, props sinking into the floor... This is the biggest complaint I have. It can become terribly frustrating to work on something for a long time to have it ruined on load... in some cases irreversibly

THE PROS:
I have had a great time building things with my kids. I love seeing them learn about logic connections between characters & props and watching them develop their own gameplay. I love the stylization & combination of the Disney properties... it's lighthearted, funny, and makes for a good time.

I'm sure there are other game builders out there that are cheaper... but this is the one I bought... My kids and I like it; and we'll continue to play.

reviewText:
I don't know why some players said that this is a bad and underrated game on steam. Anyway, I'm reviewed this game based on my experience so far. Note that I don't have Disney Infinity 1.0 and also I didn't mention Disney Infinity 2.0 Free Edition. I will always keep update this review too, because I'm going to get some of the Play Sets for this game as soon as possible.

________________________________________________________________


General
First of all, I really love Super Heroes game. Disney Infinity 2.0: Marvel Super Heroes bring back my childhood memories. I always play this kind of game when I was on school. So I bought this to memorize my childhood. Well, this game is not only play as Marvel Super Heroes Characters (don't get distract by the game title). You can also play Guardian of the Galaxy Characters, The Amazing Spiderman Characters, and Disney Original Characters. They are not only make The Avengers Play Set, but also Guardian of the Galaxy Play Set, The Amazing Spiderman Play Set, and Toy Box, that everyone make their own maps and their own storylines (more like custom stories). Some toy in the Toy Box such as the items in-game are locked, so you need to buy it with the game currency, called Blue Sparks. This Blue Sparks can be obtained in-game when you destroy items. You can join the race competition too in this game (on Toy Box or Play Sets if it's available)

________________________________________________________________


These what I got from this Starter Pack Marvel's The Avengers Play Set
Marvel's Iron Man, Thor, and Black Widow Digital Characters (Permanent to your Disney account)
Toy Box 2.0
Two Marvel Super Heroes Toy Box Games: Escape from the Kyln & Assault on Asgard
Three Trial Digital Characters (these what I got: Hulk, Spiderman, Elsa. Those are expired in the next 5 days after you buy the game.)
________________________________________________________________


The Pros(+)
+ Impressive and immersive graphics.
I have discovered that this game has a pretty good model design, because of it's simplicity. Character design in-game look same like the figure. (I didn't buy the figure, since it's really hard to buy in my country). The scenery, environments, atmosphere, the particle effects are outstanding.

+ Amazing voice-actors.
The voice characters in this game are good enough. All of their voice characters a bit similar from what we heard in the movies.

+ Good storylines.
The Avengers Play Set is included in this pack that I bought. So far, the storylines are acceptable from what I thought.

+ Very fun, addicting game and nice combo moves
This game is a box full of fun and entertaining for me. Each characters have a unique attack moves too.

________________________________________________________________


The Cons (-)
- Loading sometimes took a while.
This is the one issue that I occurred sometimes. While playing this game, I always failed to login and always retry to connect my Disney account for about 3 ~ 5 times.

- Expensive.
I must say that this game pretty expensive, but since I'm on SEA (South-East Asia) region, most Steam games are cheaper than outside the SEA region. (I bought it for only IDR 335.999 ~ US$ 30.00) I asked my friends how much was it cost on their country, and it was more than US$ 30.00, maybe? Prepare to spend more money like TF2 game, where you spend your money for virtual items.

- Most features like Play Sets are sold separately.
With a lot of money that I purchase for this game, I think this game needs more features to be unlocked, because the price is not equal with the game packs. They need to unlock at least 1 or 2 Characters.

- Decent gameplay.
Kinda same like old style of this kind of game, where you always fighting the same enemies.

________________________________________________________________


Review Update!
>> (28 Feb 2015)
So I bought Guardians of the Galaxy Play Set (include figurine and also the virtual characters) and I think the story of this play set is not that awesome, but I really like the game play.

Also, I occurred this issue: Characters level reset into level 0" for two times so far. I reported this by send ticket to Disney Infinity Team and they replied back my message through my email. They said that they are trying to fix this problem and hoping that the update patch for PC gonna be release soon in March. They also apologize for this and asked me about my Disney account
date:
they gave me free 25.000 blue sparks to my account too!

Thank you so much Disney Infinity Team! :)

>> (13+14 Mar 2015) - Finally
recommended: first patch updates (they didn't write the updates)\n\nThe one that I noticed so far for the new updates are less loading time
hoursPlayed: added video advance settings such as SSAO
voteText: Bloom etc.
helpfulPercent: and the last one is they added 2 new characters
votesHelpful: Quorra and Sam Flynn from Tron that's available in PC.\n\nI'm waiting for the payment method update
votesTotal:
so I can buy all of the items from Steam Wallet. Hope they will do this in the future.

________________________________________________________________


Overall
I'm satisfied so far playing Disney Infinity 2.0 PC version
votesFunny: even though I really hate the sensitivity of the vehicles in this game. I hope that the developer always updating this PC version in the future
commentsCount: such as adding achievements to the game
column16: changing the payment method so you can buy the items easily using Steam Wallet
column17: adding more Play Set for Disney Original character
column18: that are not only can be playable in Toy Box. This game is NOT only for 10 yo
column19:
but everyone can play this game. I will rate this game for 8/10. You might wanna try this game for free too if you want to try it out. Just go to the official web https://infinity.disney.com/en-apac and the free version download is available for PC only.

Forgive me if there's something wrong with the information that I wrote in this review.

reviewText:
Highly underrated, victim of people taking it at face value and giving it ♥♥♥♥ for being a Disney title. All these negative reviews seem to be from people who had no idea that the game was F2P and that this was a starter pack, it is unfair that this game has a mixed rating just because a few dumbasses didn't even know what the game was.

The combat for all the marvel characters is extremely fun, like damn. They all play like the best of their individual games. Spider-man was so fun it reminded me of the old days with the Tobey Macgquire Spider-man games and the N64/PS1 Spider-man game. Iron Man was well done and plays like you would expect, Hulk like the old movie games, just amazing job.

The devs also have a fantastic track record. They made the original 3 Tak and the Power of Juju games, Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3, and so much more: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanche_Software#Games_developed

Ninja Theory  (DmC, Heavenly Sword) also had helped develop the combat.

As for the Sandbox mode, it's really well done too. You can make custom levels with placed health pickups and enemy wave generation, objectives, races, etc.

There's also a player housing where you can place a ton of objects and build new rooms with items from your favorite disney movies and comics (Iron Man's suit, the scare door from monsters inc, Infinity Gauntlet, Tesseract, etc.)

reviewText:
I've been playing this with the kids and I feel like microtransactions give this experience a bad stigma it doesn't deserve.

I'll start by saying that the free version on the Disney website is where you should look first if you're considering getting this.  If you're an action/RPG aficionado, check out the Daily Challenge.  If you like open world adventure games, check out the playset demos -- I thought the Spiderman one was particularly cool.  The toybox games demos give you at least a quick overlook of what they are; there are two isometric action/RPG games and two Tower Defense games. If you like sandbox play, well, I honestly was sold on this before I even tried the toybox so I'm not sure what the toybox demo is like -- but I can tell you that I find a new cool thing to show the kids in the toybox every day.

The free version gives you free access to 3 rotating characters and demo versions of most of (all of?) the included activities.  The negative reviews on Steam all seem to be about the microtransactions, but I would argue that they are a good thing -- I'm gradually buying the content the kids and I want to play, and playing it as I buy it.  I think my only complaint is that the free trial characters are advertised when you open your Collection even after you've bought content, which led to a relatively complicated conversation with my girlfriend's 6-year-old daughter about why she couldn't be Elsa right now... If you're a parent, be prepared for that conversation.

One last thing on the microtransactions: there are hexagonal power discs advertised on the Disney site for toy box content... there is a LOT more toy box content available in-game for in-game currency, Sparks".  You can also buy Sparks from the Disney website
date: which worried me after reading all these reviews... don't let that be the thing that scares you away.  Practically everything you do in-game awards you sparks by the hundreds and I've accidentally amassed a small fortune to purchase toys with just by fooling around with the game content.  The hexagonal discs are essentially premium content.  Interestingly
recommended: round power discs (special abilities & alternate costumes) are also purchased with sparks in the PC version as opposed to being sold in booster packs.\n\nA few more things you should know: no local MP on the PC version
hoursPlayed: online interactions only.  Toybox content created using objects you don't own is playable
voteText: but you might sometimes get gated from community toyboxes because their creator built it for a specific figurine (i.e. there's a Fantasia community level we played with Apprentice Mickey.  You can use either Crystal Apprentice Mickey or Apprentice Mickey
helpfulPercent: but if you don't own either you cannot play the level.)  If you're a parent considering this for children
votesHelpful: there is cartoon violence in some (not all!) available toybox levels
votesTotal: and consistently in the toybox games and playsets.  Enemy figurines explode into 'plastic' chunks and sparks (I'd compare it to the violence in the LEGO games) which could seem a little morbid for humanoid enemies (Agrabah guards)
votesFunny: but there is no visible blood or gore.  A lot of the Disney-themed combat is pretty silly and I've found myself laughing out loud more than once at an attack or ability.\n\nAll in all this is a silly amount of fun.  Give the free version a try (you can buy this pack from here afterwards if you still want it in your steam library)."

reviewText:
Extremely buggy as of 14 March 2015.

Seems like a light and fun game to spend some time in...however, the glitches are extremely frustrating.

When moving through doorways going back into your house, also called the INterior"

recommended: you'll have to do the INterior introductory quests all over again.  After the 3rd time

reviewText:
This game is nowhere near a bad as people are making it out to be.

Points to consider.

1. Cheaper than the console version.
2. All digital. No figures/equipment needed.
3. Prices are adjusted lower to reflect the all-digital nature of it.
4. Of course, you're going to spend money on add-ons. Perform your due diligence, people!

If you like Disney and superhero games, this should be a no-brainer.

reviewText:
I have only played a little bit of the game so far, but i decided to write a review according to what i have experienced so far.

The graphics are cartoony but it works. I never played the infinity game on the console so im not sure if its any better or worse.

The game play is fluent and seems well polished. You do have to purchase additional toys in order to play with them but if your lucky to have the inifinity toys for console or DS you can use the codes to unlock them in this game.

It takes sparks to revive a dead hero .. if you dont have enough it tries to make you pay for more with real money so be careful not to accidentally spend money because you get plenty of sparks from defeating enemies and smashing the environment.

Overall this is a good game and i can recommend it to the marvel fans and others who like these game types.

reviewText: Ok why i bought this game?? Well for starters I have the collection for my console which the kids love and play a lot usually when we want to watch TV. So I got this for them and I am not disappointed the game allowed me to add all the figures via the redeem codes and now i dont have to worry about them scratching a disk or dropping one of the figures when they get crazy like kids do.\nI recommend this to any avid marvel or disney fan. Also its great for traveling with a laptop now the kids can be tied up with their tablets aswell.

reviewText: This is my favorite game of this genre. I absolutly recomend this game. If u like Marvel and Disney (like me) you will love this game. It's like a minecraft with incredible battles and your favorite heroes/characters. Music is fantastic, we are talking about Disney of course.\nThe first time I played I was sleepy but I could not stop playing. Not everything you buy with real money, you can retrieve items, characters and buildings just by playing and collecting sparks (game currency). The daily challenge is a way to motivate you to buy heroes, because you can use all to grind points.\nSo I gonna play, see you all in Disney Infinity!

reviewText:
Recommended games for fun in terms of play, suitable for all ages. I played this game when at leisure (outside of work)
I am very happy colorful world of imagination or let alone in the world editor and sharing toy box, play sets, power disk, disk hex. And toys are also very impressive for the collection
But why in the PC version is not also used physical toys like in PS4, I'm playing this game in my PS4 and PC
I like the color change when the toy attached to the physical version.

My Review:
-Excess
*Fun campaign
*Can buy a toy in the world editor (Not real money, but game money)
*Can share a collection of toys
*Beautiful graphic and colorful
*Good animation
*Sound not bad
*You can share the results of a good brew, campaign, fashion to the public or your friends
*You can download the results of the artificial
*Many collections that can be collected

-Shortage
*Campaign which is sold separately

-Conclusion
*Deserves to be played do not get bored, if you have more money you can buy a toy to be used and in the collection
Have Fun. Welcome to the world full of fantasy disney.

reviewText:
My three year old son loves it!

He has improved so much with 6hrs playing over last two weeks; his hand eye coordination is improving daily. Folks always moan about letting children play games on a PC/console but you can really see a difference in most activities.

Highly recommend for any family.

.... It will cost more than the original purchase price as your kids want every character available. We have purchased two additional so far at a cost of £3.99 each...

reviewText: I have to say I really love this game. It comes with the three starting characters (just like the physical copy for xbox, playstation and wii)  and the Marvel themed toy box games. with the PC version you also get to try out 3 characters for free on a rotational 3-5 day period, so if there is a character you want to try, you can. As the video states there are several ways to play, and with all the user made levels this game hasn't gotten old for me yet. Also have to say that my favorite part of this is that you can still buy the physical characters and use them in the PC version by using a web code that comes in the box.

reviewText: This game was fun, but adding more content does get quite pricey. Glad I was able to grab the Marvel Starter at 50%. Otherwise I would not have even started playing this. Mainly due to limited income. My other gripe with this game. Not designed for left handed players and no control edit feature. I can work around it, but does my playing very akward for me. Once you blow through the pre-made Quest (after buying the required charaters) that game losses its fun and flare. Then just becomes a money suck. Don't waste your time.
